title: Asistant Setup
description:
Numer stanowiska: 44082
Grupa: Magna Mechatronics, Mirrors & Lighting
Oddział: Magna Lighting
Rodzaj stanowiska: stałe
Miejscowość: Kostrzyn nad Odrą

 

Opis grupy

Grupa Mechatronics, Mirrors and Lighting specjalizuje się w technologiach motoryzacyjnych, które kształtują przyszłość mobilności. Czerpiąc z głębokiej wiedzy o systemach, MML opracowuje wyjątkowe technologie dostępu do pojazdów, inteligentne systemy wizyjne i zaawansowane technologie oświetlenia pojazdów, wytyczając nowe drogi do innowacyjności, bezpieczeństwa i stylistyki.

 

Kluczowe obowiązki

•    Montaż form wtryskowych na maszynę wtryskową
•    Podłączanie formy według schematu z karty technologicznej  
•    Zapewnienie optymalnych parametrów technologicznych maszyn podczas produkcji zgodnie z kartą technologiczną
•    Pakowanie wyprasek 
•    Dbałość o utrzymanie porządku na stanowisku pracy

Kluczowe kwalifikacje/wymagania

•    Wykształcenie zasadnicze zawodowe lub średnie techniczne o profilu: mechanik
•    Doświadczenie w firmie produkcyjnej przy obsłudze wtryskarek lub na podobnym stanowisku
•    Wiedza teoretyczna  z zakresu obróbki tworzyw sztucznych 
•    Umiejętność pracy w zespole 
•    Dokładność i sumienność 
•    Szybkość w działaniu

Świadomość. Jedność. Wzmocnienie.

W Magna wierzymy, że zróżnicowana siła robocza ma kluczowe znaczenie dla naszego sukcesu. Dlatego też jesteśmy dumni z tego, że jesteśmy pracodawcą oferującym równe szanse. Zatrudniamy na podstawie doświadczenia i kwalifikacji oraz z uwzględnieniem wymogów stanowiska, bez względu na, w szczególności, kolor skóry, pochodzenie, wyznanie, płeć, pochodzenie, orientację seksualną, wiek, obywatelstwo, stan cywilny, niepełnosprawność lub tożsamość płciową. Magna poważnie traktuje ochronę Państwa danych osobowych. Odradzamy wysyłanie aplikacji pocztą elektroniczną w celu zapewnienia zgodności z RODO i lokalnymi wymogami dotyczącymi prywatności danych.

title: Setup Operator / Full-Time Production
description:
Dessert Holdings is a leading baked goods platform providing premium layer cakes, cheesecakes, brownies, bars, and other desserts to the retail in-store bakery ("ISB") and foodservice channels on a largely private label basis. We are a rapidly growing company comprised of The Original Cakerie (acq. December 2015), Lawler's Foods (acq. July 2016), and Atlanta Cheesecake Company (acq. January 2018). We are poised for continued growth by bringing high quality products to both retail grocery and food service across North America. Led by a senior team with strong company pedigrees and experience driving improvement – we have exciting opportunities to be a part of this high performance, growth focused organization.    

We currently have an opportunities for Setup Operator / Full time production personnel to join our team. 

Position Description:

This position performs all duties assigned by the Setup Manager, Supervisor and Shift Operations Manager. 

Responsibilities & Duties:  (This is meant to be an outline, not an exhaustive list of responsibilities)

  • Equipment set up and troubleshooting adjustments, to keep products within standard and to keep all the lines running at or above required performance.
  • Maintaining the required hygiene standards of the equipment and the facility, consistent with GMP standards and Master Sanitation Schedules.
  • Removing waste from the production areas as needed.
  • Safe use, storage, and maintenance of all company supplied cleaning equipment and materials.
  • Supporting contract cleaning and maintenance services when necessary.
  • Maintaining all BRC audit paperwork and other required documentation as may be required.
  • Liaising with appropriate staff throughout the shift to ensure continuous process and quality standards.
  • Supporting line staff on day-to-day basis for general troubleshooting/problem-solving/conflict resolution.  Get rid of this line.
  • Adhering to safety, quality and performance standards.
  • Supporting training and continuous learning activities within the department.
  • Responsible to practice the 5 steps of cleaning at all times

Position Requirements: 

  • Comfortable working with exposure to cold temperatures
  • Ability to work independently, well organized, effective judgment
  • Mechanical aptitude is a requirement
  • Accountable for the Master Cleaning Schedule
  • Excellent attendance record and demonstrated reliability
  • Ability to perform heavy lifting, climb stairs, navigate around equipment, and work with a sense of urgency
  • Cooperative and works well with others, strong communicator
  • Willing and able to be trained on working at heights and safe use of aerial platform equipment (Genie-boom Lifts, Scissor Lifts)    

Schedule: Flexible Monday - Saturday (working 8 hour shifts, 5 out of the 6 days each week)

Currently have openings on our "C" shift

C shift 5:00pm - 1:30am or 9:30pm - 6:00am

You must be available for each start time on the specified shift.

Setup shifts will be prioritized and backfilled with productions shifts.

Pay rates:  - When working as Setup Probationary rate - $21.81/hour ; Full rate - $24.24/hour

                     When working as Production Probationary rate - $18.06/hour ; Full rate - $20.08/hour

                     

This position also provides comprehensive benefits package and RRSP contributions after probation is complete.

We appreciate your interest in joining The Original Cakerie team.  Due to volume of candidates applying, only short listed applicants will be contacted.

HPAPP

title: Permanent Setup Operator
description:
Are you a machine operator with experience in various manufacturing environments? Do you know how to set up equipment and troubleshoot adjustments? Do you maintain a clean and orderly work environment?

We would like to meet you!

Come and be part of a team of machine operators in a large manufacturing company in Ingersoll, Ontario. You will be responsible for setting up and running machinery for flat-rolled steel. Some hand and power tool and drill press experience will be an asset to assembling and finishing steel when required.

Job Title: Set Up Operator - Flat-rolled steel
Location: Ingersoll, Ontario

Shift: Bi-weekly rotations of days and afternoons
Hours: 6 am to 2 pm and 2 pm to 10 pm (Monday to Friday)
Pay rate: $18.89 hourly to start, at 3 months there will be a pay increase to $20.91 hourly and at 1 year an increase to $25.27 hourly


Advantages
Why make the job change?

Permanent job opportunity
Long-term job opportunity
Full-time hours
Pay increases 2 times in the first year up to $25.27 an hour
Benefits after 3 months
RRSP and Pension benefits after 3 months
2 weeks paid vacation first year
Overtime available after 40 hours
Bonus pay
Training involved
Welcoming environment to new employees
Strong team-oriented company

Responsibilities
Be a reliable team member who works at all times focusing on Safety and Accuracy while being productive.

1. Set up machine according to production schedule
2. Maintain correct locations for tooling
3. Maintain tooling with great care
4. Clean tooling before installing on arbor
5. Ensure the knives are of the highest quality
6. Inspect set up for accuracy
7. Maintain and improve all daily procedures
8. Increase safety and productivity at highest level of quality
9. Maintain and improve a high level of health and safety
10. Build set up according to ASKO
11. Ensure correctness of order from start to finish
12. Troubleshooting of slitting problems
13. Assist operators with loading and unloading of material
14. Build separators as required
15. Assist packager
16. Maintain a clean work area
17. Other duties as assigned by plant supervisor/management

Qualifications
Who are we looking for?

Someone with machine operating experience
High School diploma or greater
1-2 year experience in manufacturing
Forklift and crane experience asset
Basic mechanical knowledge of machines is an asset

Summary
How to apply:

To apply for this position email your resume to Oksana at oksana.chanas@randstad.ca
Or call the office 519..679.0058 ext 1 and ask for Oksana or Jenny
Or apply online at randstad.ca

We are text-friendly. Feel free to text us at 226-387-3922


Are you interested in making your next career move, but this one doesn’t sound right? Please give us a call – we have an extensive list of open positions in the Brantford area. We look forward to speaking with you!

If this job is not for you, but you’re interested in a career change, please call the phone number above and let us know what you’re looking for. We would love to help find you your dream job!

Make sure you download our new app called 'myrandstad' in the Google Play Store or the App Store and give us a call so we can set you up with a pin. This is the new way to get all the latest job notifications! If you need help setting up the app just stop by our office or give us a call and we'll be happy to help!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Profile Plastic Extrusion Operator
description:
Description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Plastic Extrusion Machine Operator for our client who prides themselves on their production based on innovative designs.
Agilus is recruiting for a Plastic Extrusion Machine Operator in the skilled trades in Winnipeg, Manitoba.
This position is a full-time permanent role situated in St. Boniface area. Our client is a well known manufacturing company of quality plastic products and leads in providing the best customer service to its clientele.
Duties:
  • • Select Machine Dies
  • • Synchronize speed of extrusions
  • • Ensure conformance to specifications / adjust as necessary
  • • Set control to regulate vacuum, air pressure, sizing rings and temperature
  • • Troubleshoot and make minor adjustments to equipment
  • • Pack items for shipping and distribution
  • • Monitor and inspect quality of material produced

Requirements:
  • • Must have a forklift operator certification
  • • Must have 1-2 years of extrusion experience in a similar role
  • • Good communication skills, written and verbal
  • • Available to work in evening shift
  • • Must have a valid driver's license and a reliable vehicle

What's in it for you:
  • Competitive salary is offered based on experience.
  • Benefits package and paid vacation

Interested?
Please apply directly online or contact Charmaine by email cpadaoan@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Day Shift Extrusion Machine Operator
description:
Day Shift Extrusion Operator
12 hour 8p-8a, 2-2-3 rotation
TC Transcontinental, Making Impressions Count

TC Transcontinental is a leader in flexible packaging in North America, and Canada’s largest printer. The Corporation is also the leading Canadian French-language educational publishing group. For over 40 years, TC Transcontinental’s story has been one of innovation and transformation to meet our customers’ evolving needs. Our strong family values, entrepreneurial spirit and long-term vision have always been at the heart of our success.  With our 3 business sectors of Packaging, Print and Media, we continue to optimize, transform and grow while making impressions that count! 
TC Transcontinental Packaging brings a distinctive blend of Art, Science and Technology to create flexible packaging that preserves our customers' products and accentuates their brands on the store shelf. The Packaging Sector has over 4,000 employees and 25 facilities worldwide specializing in extrusion, lamination, printing and converting of plastic products.  
We share the Ellen MacArthur Foundation’s vision of a circular economy for plastic, where plastic never becomes waste and have committed, by 2025, for 100% of our plastic packaging to be reusable, recyclable or compostable. And most recently, we joined the United Nations Global Compact – a voluntary initiative of signatory companies committing to social responsibilities around human rights, labor standards and environmental protection.  You will join a high-performing team that is dedicated to sustainability and passionate about our people, operations, communities and products.

About this opportunity

This position will report to the Shift Supervisor. Performs machine set-up for orders, safely operates machine to production target, waste, and quality standards, and trouble shoots machine when it is down or not performing to standard. 

What you will do
  • Read orders, select proper resins and additives.
  • Operate extruders and resin-handling equipment.
  • Operate extruders at maximum output with minimum scrap generated.
  • Make necessary quality checks utilizing micrometer, and dyne test solutions.
  • Keep all necessary records including production, quality control, time utilization and material usage.
  • Clean dyes, changes dyes and screen packs.
  • Responsible for routine operating maintenance.
  • Responsible for labeling material and moving rolls and carts to staging area.
  • Abide by all rules and procedures that govern the extrusion department.
  • Support and contribute to a healthy and safe work environment by following all workplace regulations, policies, and initiatives, including reporting all first aid injuries, accidents, and workplace hazards.

What you have to offer
  • High School Diploma with 2+ years in general warehouse operations.
  • Ability to read and understand simple written materials.  Ability to write simple statements and numbers. Ability to perform arithmetic calculations with fractions and decimals.
  • Previous blown film extrusion experience preferred as well as minor mechanical troubleshooting            experience.
  • Average dexterity and coordination. Ability to climb stairs and lift up to 50lbs.
  • Frequent mental/visual attention to monitor extruder operation. Ability to distinguish colors.
  • Must be able to work in a team environment.   Must adhere to plant safety and housekeeping standards.


What we have to offer
  • Opportunity to be part of a dynamic and highly motivating work environment where you can develop your potential and launch an exciting career.
  • Development opportunities where your input makes a difference. A competitive compensation package, 401K plan and flexible benefits that are customizable to you and your family’s needs];
  • Employee perks such as discounts from suppliers on various products and services such as insurance, wireless bundles, travel, and much more. 

Learn more about us
https://tctranscontinental.com/en-us/packaging
https://www.facebook.com/TC-Transcontinental-Packaging

talent@tc.tc

title: Extrusion Operator
description:
Join KP Building Products’ Production team in Brampton, ON.

What’s in it for YOU?
Want to advance in your career and earn more? Would you enjoy a direct hire, full time opportunity that offers 3-4 days off a week? Earn more as you learn more in this career with a stable organization that will invest in your future, helping you advance and increase your value.

KP Building Products, a member of the Kaycan Group of companies, is seeking Extrusion Operators of all levels to join our continental shift teams in our Brampton, Ontario facility.

If you have production, warehouse, construction or related experience, this is a career you need to explore.

Shifts: 12h continental shifts / Rotating every 2 weeks – Day and Night
Salary starting at: $18.00 per hour

We offer:

  • Health and Dental benefits
  • RRSP
  • Ongoing training initiatives
  • Yearly Safety Boot Allowance
  • Prescription Safety Glasses Allowance
  • Vacation & paid time off

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure all lines are running without quality concerns at the beginning and throughout your shift
  • Keep in contact, if need arises, with Lead Hand Operator, Packer and Production Supervisor when changes occur. (eg. colour changes, scrapping, etc.)
  • Help other operators when needed
  • Make all quality checks as required. Finished products must match all quality standards assigned. (eg. Cosmetic, Functional, and Appearance etc.)
  • Assist in line changeovers including die removal and replacement
  • Maintain housekeeping of your lines and workstation
  • Light maintenance, minor repairs and adjustments to correct extrusion problems
  • Operator extrusion, downtime tracking and running sheets are completed
  • Packer relief as needed
  • Follow any reasonable request from a Supervisor
  • Follow KP Building's ISO quality management system
  • Participate in training as required by the company
  • Adhere to all applicable company policies and procedures, including quality and health and safety

Qualifications:

  • Competed high school diploma, GED, or equivalent
  • One (1) year experience as an extrusion operator within a manufacturing environment, preferably plastics extrusion is an asset
  • Machine Operator experience an asset and willing to learn
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Mechanically inclined and willing to learn

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Back- Up Extrusion Operator - Food Processing
description:
The Company:Grand River Foods is a leading food solutions company serving customers in the North American grocery and food service industry. As a member of the Sunrise Farm family, we remain as dedicated as ever to both providing a quality work environment for our employees, as well as producing only the highest quality products for our customers. We are known for the great care we take with clients and employees alike.

The Location: Grand River Foods is based in Cambridge, Ontario. Our location is commutable from a number of cities in the region: Kitchener, Waterloo, Brantford, Guelph, and more. For those living in Cambridge, our facility is located nearby a number of GRT transit stops.

GRF is currently seeking a back-up operator for the Extrusion on on the afternoon shift.

Afternoon shift: start times varying between 1:30pm and 2:30pm, 9 hours shifts Monday to Friday with some overtime required on weekends.

GRF operates in a fast-paced, and physical environment. Applicants must be comfortable handling plant-based protein products (soy and pea) and must be comfortable with 20-40 pounds of repetitive lifting. We are currently seeking candidates who have experience with machine operation in a food processing facility.

Responsibilities:

  • Equipment setup, assembly/disassembly and operation
  • Utilization of specific production tools and equipment
  • Ability to troubleshoot mechanical problems
  • Accurately document production results
  • Adherence to strict operating procedures and food safety guidelines
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Regularly inspect work environment for good housekeeping
  • Communicate effectively with Team Leaders and other employees
  • Manually pack product into bags, cartons or other containers
  • Remove finished goods cartons from conveyor and place on pallets
  • Spread products after the extruder for evenness & look for foreign material
  • Inspect and sort products and packages that do not meet specified standards
  • Lifting, dumping and stacking 10-40 lbs. boxes of product
  • Pushing 200-500 lbs. bins from blending area to production line (bins are on wheels)
  • Regularly inspect work environment for good housekeeping
  • Repetitive tasks and standing in one spot for extended periods of time
  • Must wear all Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) supplied
  • Other relevant duties as assigned

Requirements:

  • Experience with machine operation in a food processing environment
  • Legally eligible to work in Canada
  • Able to communicate effectively with teammates and leadership
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and in a team environment
  • 18 years of age or older
  • Good attendance record required
  • A positive attitude and willing to develop new skills
  • Comfortable working around plant-based proteins (handling using gloves, smells, etc).
  • Previous food industry experience including GMPs and basic food handling are assets

Benefits:

  • Comprehensive benefits after three-month probation
  • Option to participate in GRF Pension Program after three-month probation
  • Opportunity for advancement
  • Product can be purchased at a reduced cost
  • All company PPE provided

Apply Now!

Grand River Foods (Cambridge) embraces diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. Grand River Foods (Cambridge) is dedicated to attracting, development and retaining talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005, under the Human Rights Code accommodation will be provided at any point throughout the recruitment process, the candidate will need to make their accommodation need known to the HR Department.

title: Extruder Operator - $3,000 Sign On Bonus
description:
Hours: 12 hours shifts - Day: 7am-7pm; Night: 7pm-7am.

Shift Rotation: Day shift: 2 on, 2 off, 3 on, 2 off, 2 on, 3 off -Repeat but on night shift.

This is a 2 week rotation.

This position is eligible to receive a $3,000 sign-on bonus, broken into 2 payments of $1,500 to be paid at six and twelve months.

Job Summary

Perform and report extrusion operations in order to comply with safety, quality and productivity targets

Essential Duties (Responsibilities)

All PPE must be worn in compliance with the OHSA/RC requirements
Enforce/Respect the safety rules and the internal policy
Stop any equipment / operative works / external company works if safety/environment protection/fire protection rules are broken
Guarantee and apply ISO 14001 (Environment), and all related working procedures
Ownership of environmental responsibilities listed in ENV-REF-002 - Associates SEA Matrix
Guarantee and apply ISO 9001, FSS/ISO22000, Mars Standards, and all related working procedures
Support the HACCP program in the department
Follow GMP-GHP in the area
Inform Shift Supervisor of quality deviations according to product standards and production procedures
Maintain CCPs and oPrPs in the department
Perform the CCP and oPrP's procedure according to SOPs
Sampling of products to ensure quality control (micro sampling)
Report any pest activity to related Manager
Perform and record quality control tests
Adhere to multi-skills policy and acquire at least one additional competence as established with and by Management
Training: attend any training program as scheduled by company management and train any designed person in the position
Perform extruding line start up sequence processes
Run the extruding processes
Perform extruding line shut down sequence processes
Assign FP silos and instruct packaging operator
Control and maintain a constant supply of coating powders and liquids to the coater in cooperation with the RM handler
Perform area-related equipment first level maintenance
Perform inventory of raw ingredients / packaging materials / finished products in bins, silos and racks (cyclical and period end inventories)
Any task as delegated by Manager
Perform Housekeeping Checks to ensure compliance to 5S
Perform operational cleaning operations
Change ver cleaning
Weekly cleaning & Sanitatin
Hyp cleaning
Provide any requested documentation to other Departments according to internal rules
Shift changes: communicate with co-worker of next shift about machine problems, progress on production schedule, bin inventories, quality issue...
Complete production reports as required by manager and record any production events (stops, quantity, quality...)

BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS

Training and/or experience in functional tasks (opt: knowledge of feed/food industry)
Must be willing to work irregular hours and extended shift if necessary
Safety & Hygiene & Quality conscious, Initiative, Self motivated, Team player, Technically inclined, Depth perception, Tolerance to hot environment, Unrestricted range of motion, Color discrimination, olfactory and texture perception

title: Progressive Set-Up / Operator
description:
Posted Date:4/28/2022
Job Category:
Position Title:Progressive Set-Up / Operator
Salary Range:$25.00 - $30.00
Location:Vaughan, Ontario, Canada
Desired Skills:
Description:Our client, a global world class manufacturer in the Vaughan area, is currently recruiting for a Progressive Set-up / operator.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
Opportunity to work for a very well respected, world class manufacturer that has enjoyed many years of success and stability.
Paid additional training and development.
Excellent growth and advancement opportunities.
An excellent compensation package including:
- Competitive salary
- Excellent benefits
- RRSP matching
- Profit sharing

Minimum qualifications:
- 3 years experience as a Progressive Press Set-Up Operator
- Must have knowledge of First and Last Off Procedure
- Must have knowledge of loading, unloading and storing of tooling equipment in appropriate area
- Knowledge of press controls and tooling protection or other pieces of equipment to run a press
- Valid forklift license and ability to operate 6000 lb. to 12000 lb. lift trucks
- Must have knowledge to set all tooling for all presses
- Must have knowledge of operating presses for both manual and progressive dies
- Must have knowledge of all Inspection Records, SPC Charts and checking fixtures
- Must have knowledge of measuring equipment, such as; micrometer and vernier, caliper

Responsibilities include:
- Ensure that at all times prior to set–up, safety checklist is followed, completed and recorded
- Must be able to organize, properly prepare and have foresight to be fully equipped to set-up utilizing a quick die change system
- Ability to follow written set-up instructions and fill out proper set-up papers
- Ability to operate safely 10 to 40 ton cranes with appropriate sling or chain. Must have training certificate
- Must have knowledge to properly set counter balance air according to tool weight
- Ability to load coils on uncoilers, preparation for use, and start strip through die

Contact and Resume Submission
If you feel you are an excellent candidate and have the required skills and experience indicated above, please send your attached resume and any important details to HCR Permanent Search, care of the Recruitment Consultant listed below. Only qualified candidates who can work in Canada without restriction will be contacted.


Dennis Bossé
Director of Operations
HCR Permanent Search
(905) 669-2400 x2236
Email: dbosse@hcr.ca
www.hcrpermsearch.com

title: Extrusion Operator
description:
Want to advance in your career and earn more?
Join a stable organization that will invest in your future, helping you advance and increase your value!

KP Building Products, a member of the Kaycan Group of companies is seeking Extrusion Operators of all levels to join our teams at our Brampton facility. If you have production, warehouse, construction or related experience, this is a career you need to explore.

Schedule: Continental shifts - 3-2-2-3 / 12-hour
Salary starting at: $18/h

We offer :

  • Dental, Medical, Life and Disability insurance plan
  • RRSP plan
  • Pension Plan
  • Ongoing training initiatives
  • Opportunities for growth & development;

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure production goals are met and works closely with the production and quality teams to ensure the product is to the quality standards
  • Ensure all lines are running without quality concerns at the beginning and throughout your shift
  • Keep in contact, if need arises, with Lead Hand Operator, Packer and Production Supervisor when changes occur. (eg. colour changes, scrapping, etc.)
  • Help other operators when needed
  • Make all quality checks as required. Finished products must match all quality standards assigned. (eg. Cosmetic, Functional, and Appearance etc.)
  • Assist in line changeovers including die removal and replacement
  • Maintain housekeeping of your lines and workstation
  • Light maintenance, minor repairs and adjustments to correct extrusion problems
  • Operator extrusion, downtime tracking and running sheets are completed
  • Packer relief as needed
  • Follow any reasonable request from a Supervisor
  • Follow KP Building's ISO quality management system
  • Participate in training as required by the company
  • Adhere to all applicable company policies and procedures, including quality and health and safety

Qualifications:

  • Completed high school diploma, GED, or equivalent
  • One (1) year experience as an extrusion operator within a manufacturing environment
  • Experience in plastics extrusion - an asset
  • Working Conditions
  • Ability to work 12-hour continental shifts. (42 hours a week)
  • Safety glasses and boots are required throughout the plant; PPE as required
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Press Set-Up Operator - Afternoons
description:
Job Number: 40812 
Group: Magna Exteriors  
Division: Mytox Mfg. 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: Woodbridge 

 

Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

QUALIFICATIONS NECESSARY TO DO THE JOB:

•    Ensure that at all times prior to set–up, safety checklist is followed, completed and recorded
•    Must have knowledge of First and Last Off  Procedure
•    Must have knowledge of loading, unloading and storing of tooling equipment in appropriate safety area
•    Must have knowledge to set all tooling for all presses
•    Must have knowledge of operating presses  for both  manual and  progressive dies
•    Must have knowledge of all Inspection Records,  SPC Charts and checking fixtures
•    Must have knowledge of measuring equipment, such as; micrometer and  vernier, and caliper 
•    Must be able to organize,  properly prepare  and have foresight to be fully equipped to set-up  
utilizing a quick die change system
•    Must have experience in starting and shutting down of all equipment necessary to run appropriate press
•    Knowledge on how to inspect press and tooling at the beginning of the shift
•    Good English (both written and verbal) communication skills
•    Basic Mathematical skills
•    Must be able to work overtime when required and willing to help out when necessary as per customer demands

DESIRABLE ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

•    Valid forklift license and ability to operate 6000 lb. to 12000 lb. lift trucks
•    Ability to follow written set-up instructions and fill out proper set-up papers/maintain tool work order

MAIN DUTIES AND ACTIVITIES OF JOB:

•    Knowledge  of press controls and tooling protection or other pieces of equipment to run a press
•    Must be able to communicate issues/problems to area leader
•    Ability to order or to have in stock all necessary equipment and parts required for quick die change
•    Must be able to coordinate with other departments i.e. maintenance, toolroom, etc.
•    Must be able to maintain operation of “two” simultaneously running presses
•    Must be  able to keep “one” press cycling while doing set-up on the other press
•    Must be able to communicate with area leader, maintenance, toolroom , etc. concerning any problems/requirements affecting operation of two presses, tooling problem solving
•    Knowledge of how to use die cart and die tables
•    Ability to operate safely 10 to 40 ton cranes with appropriate sling or chain. Must have training certificate
•    Must have knowledge to properly set  counter balance air according to tool weight
•    Experience in tooling set-up with roll feeders and die protection
•    Ability to load coils on uncoilers, preparation for use, and start strip through  die
•    Ability to input production data into the system and follow required schedule
•    Able to complete a Forklift Safety checklist
•    Must be organized  and clean up before and after set-up, including moping of the floor
•    Knowledge of WHMIS/GHS
•    Good organizational skills, ability to work well without supervision
•    Attend training based on Mytox Internal Training Matric
•    Utilize effective Housekeeping Practices
•    Adhere to all safety rules and regulations as outlined in the Mytox Employee Handbook
•    Follows all applicable Mytox BOS procedures
•    Any other reasonable request made by Management 

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Extruder Operator
description:
Job Summary

Extrusion Operators are system experts in their assigned area, and are highly functional in multiple areas. Extrusion Operators must also ensure efficiency, operational conformance, product quality and continuous improvement. Extrusion Operators function as a member of an area team which is directly responsible for the efficient production of quality products in the required quantities. They operate/change over specified machinery in the assigned area in the prescribed amount of time. Extrusion Operators must have the skill set to perform the tasks of other associates in the area as needed. This job requires Strong Communication, Interpersonal and Team Building skills to support site objectives

Key Accountabilities

• Responsible for the basic/routine running of packaging/process equipment to complete the conversion process and package finishe d product prior to shipping in accordance with all routine SOPs and specifications

• Loading of packaging material/raw material

• Clearing jams/troubleshooting process issues

• Resetting faults

• Product changeovers

• Product quality checks and report issues to Technical Operator

• Maintaining area GMP's

• Complete basic preventative maintenance work orders as assigned (e.g. lubrication, observation, CILs etc) and enter corrective work order requests into the MIS

• Active participation in the Safety program as it applies to the Process/Packaging Area, including area audits and conformance to all area LOTO and safety procedures

• Responsible for following all Quality and Food Safety Policies and applicable procedures

Quality and Food Safety

Utilizing knowledge of Q/FS systems the associate ensures Food Safety requirements are effectively performed. This includes training of other associates on the Food Safety & Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP), ensuring CCP monitoring is in effect and continuous improvement of the process with any changes to our working environment is practiced.

Key Technical Knowledge and Skills

• Mechanical aptitude

• Basic troubleshooting skills

• SPC

• Safety & safe work practices

• Knowledge of food safety, GMP's, ISO, HACCP

Critical Learning Experiences

• Operational experience

• Packaging and process experience

title: Extrusion Operator
description:
Join KP Building Products' Production team in Brampton, ON.

What's in it for YOU?
Want to advance in your career and earn more? Would you enjoy a direct hire, full time opportunity that offers 3-4 days off a week? Earn more as you learn more in this career with a stable organization that will invest in your future, helping you advance and increase your value.

KP Building Products, a member of the Kaycan Group of companies, is seeking Extrusion Operators of all levels to join our continental shift teams in our Brampton, Ontario facility.

If you have production, warehouse, construction or related experience, this is a career you need to explore.

Shifts: 12h continental shifts / Rotating every 2 weeks – Day and Night
Salary starting at: $18.00 per hour

We offer:

  • Health and Dental benefits
  • RRSP
  • Ongoing training initiatives
  • Yearly Safety Boot Allowance
  • Prescription Safety Glasses Allowance
  • Vacation & paid time off

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure all lines are running without quality concerns at the beginning and throughout your shift
  • Keep in contact, if need arises, with Lead Hand Operator, Packer and Production Supervisor when changes occur. (eg. colour changes, scrapping, etc.)
  • Help other operators when needed
  • Make all quality checks as required. Finished products must match all quality standards assigned. (eg. Cosmetic, Functional, and Appearance etc.)
  • Assist in line changeovers including die removal and replacement
  • Maintain housekeeping of your lines and workstation
  • Light maintenance, minor repairs and adjustments to correct extrusion problems
  • Operator extrusion, downtime tracking and running sheets are completed
  • Packer relief as needed
  • Follow any reasonable request from a Supervisor
  • Follow KP Building's ISO quality management system
  • Participate in training as required by the company
  • Adhere to all applicable company policies and procedures, including quality and health and safety

Qualifications:

  • Competed high school diploma, GED, or equivalent
  • One (1) year experience as an extrusion operator within a manufacturing environment, preferably plastics extrusion is an asset
  • Machine Operator experience an asset and willing to learn
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Mechanically inclined and willing to learn

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Extruder Operator - $3,000 Sign-On Bonus
description:
Hours: 12 hours shifts - Day: 7am-7pm; Night: 7pm-7am.

Shift Rotation: Day shift: 2 on, 2 off, 3 on, 2 off, 2 on, 3 off -Repeat but on night shift.

This is a 2 week rotation.

This position is eligible to receive a $3,000 sign-on bonus, broken into 2 payments of $1,500 to be paid at six and twelve months.

Job Summary

Perform and report extrusion operations in order to comply with safety, quality and productivity targets

Essential Duties (Responsibilities)

All PPE must be worn in compliance with the OHSA/RC requirements
Enforce/Respect the safety rules and the internal policy
Stop any equipment / operative works / external company works if safety/environment protection/fire protection rules are broken
Guarantee and apply ISO 14001 (Environment), and all related working procedures
Ownership of environmental responsibilities listed in ENV-REF-002 - Associates SEA Matrix
Guarantee and apply ISO 9001, FSS/ISO22000, Mars Standards, and all related working procedures
Support the HACCP program in the department
Follow GMP-GHP in the area
Inform Shift Supervisor of quality deviations according to product standards and production procedures
Maintain CCPs and oPrPs in the department
Perform the CCP and oPrP's procedure according to SOPs
Sampling of products to ensure quality control (micro sampling)
Report any pest activity to related Manager
Perform and record quality control tests
Adhere to multi-skills policy and acquire at least one additional competence as established with and by Management
Training: attend any training program as scheduled by company management and train any designed person in the position
Perform extruding line start up sequence processes
Run the extruding processes
Perform extruding line shut down sequence processes
Assign FP silos and instruct packaging operator
Control and maintain a constant supply of coating powders and liquids to the coater in cooperation with the RM handler
Perform area-related equipment first level maintenance
Perform inventory of raw ingredients / packaging materials / finished products in bins, silos and racks (cyclical and period end inventories)
Any task as delegated by Manager
Perform Housekeeping Checks to ensure compliance to 5S
Perform operational cleaning operations
Change ver cleaning
Weekly cleaning & Sanitatin
Hyp cleaning
Provide any requested documentation to other Departments according to internal rules
Shift changes: communicate with co-worker of next shift about machine problems, progress on production schedule, bin inventories, quality issue...
Complete production reports as required by manager and record any production events (stops, quantity, quality...)

BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS

Training and/or experience in functional tasks (opt: knowledge of feed/food industry)
Must be willing to work irregular hours and extended shift if necessary
Safety & Hygiene & Quality conscious, Initiative, Self motivated, Team player, Technically inclined, Depth perception, Tolerance to hot environment, Unrestricted range of motion, Color discrimination, olfactory and texture perception

* External Footer

External Footer Required.

Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Extruder Operator - $1,500 Sign-On Bonus
description:
Hours: 12 hours shifts - Day: 7am-7pm; Night: 7pm-7am.

Shift Rotation: Day shift: 2 on, 2 off, 3 on, 2 off, 2 on, 3 off - Repeat but on night shift.

This is a 2 week rotation.

This position is eligible to receive a $1,500 sign-on bonus, broken into 3 payments of $500 to be paid out on day one and at the 6 and 12 month marks.

Job Summary

Perform and report extrusion operations in order to comply with safety, quality and productivity targets

Essential Duties (Responsibilities)

All PPE must be worn in compliance with the OHSA/RC requirements
Enforce/Respect the safety rules and the internal policy
Stop any equipment / operative works / external company works if safety/environment protection/fire protection rules are broken
Guarantee and apply ISO 14001 (Environment), and all related working procedures
Ownership of environmental responsibilities listed in ENV-REF-002 - Associates SEA Matrix
Guarantee and apply ISO 9001, FSS/ISO22000, Mars Standards, and all related working procedures
Support the HACCP program in the department
Follow GMP-GHP in the area
Inform Shift Supervisor of quality deviations according to product standards and production procedures
Maintain CCPs and oPrPs in the department
Perform the CCP and oPrP's procedure according to SOPs
Sampling of products to ensure quality control (micro sampling)
Report any pest activity to related Manager
Perform and record quality control tests
Adhere to multi-skills policy and acquire at least one additional competence as established with and by Management
Training: attend any training program as scheduled by company management and train any designed person in the position
Perform extruding line start up sequence processes
Run the extruding processes
Perform extruding line shut down sequence processes
Assign FP silos and instruct packaging operator
Control and maintain a constant supply of coating powders and liquids to the coater in cooperation with the RM handler
Perform area-related equipment first level maintenance
Perform inventory of raw ingredients / packaging materials / finished products in bins, silos and racks (cyclical and period end inventories)
Any task as delegated by Manager
Perform Housekeeping Checks to ensure compliance to 5S
Perform operational cleaning operations
Change ver cleaning
Weekly cleaning & Sanitatin
Hyp cleaning
Provide any requested documentation to other Departments according to internal rules
Shift changes: communicate with co-worker of next shift about machine problems, progress on production schedule, bin inventories, quality issue...
Complete production reports as required by manager and record any production events (stops, quantity, quality...)

BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS

Training and/or experience in functional tasks (opt: knowledge of feed/food industry)
Must be willing to work irregular hours and extended shift if necessary
Safety & Hygiene & Quality conscious, Initiative, Self motivated, Team player, Technically inclined, Depth perception, Tolerance to hot environment, Unrestricted range of motion, Color discrimination, olfactory and texture perception
